sen.e: FUJIAWARA no Sukeyo (847 ~ 897) was a Teishin (retainer of Imperial Court) and scholar of the early Heian period.

sen.j: 菅原是善門下で学を修め、文章得業生となり、元慶3年（879年）には陽成天皇の侍読の任に当たるなど、次第に学者としての名声を確立した。
sen.e: He studied as a disciple of SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi and became a Monjo tokugosho (Distinguished Scholars of Letters), and in 879, he was appointed to Jidoku (imperial tutor) of Emperor Yozei and gradually added to his laurels as a scholar.

sen.j: 文章博士の地位にあった仁和3年（887年）、橘広相が作成した宇多天皇から基経への詔勅にあった「阿衡」の文字に関し、「阿衡には位貴しも、職掌なし」という見解を発して、所謂「阿衡の紛議」を引き起こした。
sen.e: In 887 when he was at the post of Monjo hakase (professor of literature), he found letters of "Ako (another name of Sessho (regent) and Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor))" in the Shochoku (imperial edict) from Emperor Uda to Mototsune written by TACHIBANA no Hiromi, saying that "Ako is only a name of rank and poor in substance without official duties" and caused so-called the "Ako Controversy."
